ctu_text: \n", "briefDescription": "\"West Bengal Migrant Workers\u2019 Welfare Scheme: Repatriation of Dead Body\" is a social welfare scheme implemented by the West Bengal Migrant Workers\u2019 Welfare Board, that provides an one time assistance to the nominee for bringing the dead body of the registered migrant worker in case of death. ", "detailedDescription": [{"type": "align_justify", "children": [{"type": "paragraph", "children": [{"text": "\"West Bengal Migrant Workers\u2019 Welfare Scheme: Repatriation of Dead Body\" is a social welfare scheme implemented by the West Bengal Migrant Workers\u2019 Welfare Board, Labour Department, Government of West Bengal on 25th April, 2023. Under this scheme, if any registered Migrant Worker dies in the course of employment outside the State of West Bengal, an assistance of \u20b9 25,000/- will be provided to the nominee of the worker for bringing the dead body to his/ her permanent address. - The applicant must be a resident of West Bengal. 
- The applicant’s age should be between 18-60 years. 
- The applicant must be ordinarily a worker who is employed/ likely to be employed in any State/Union Territories other than the state of West Bengal/ Outside India.
